data.title: Best Buddies in Virginia & DC
data.meta_description:
Best Buddies in Virginia & DC | 840 followers on LinkedIn. Friendship, Jobs, Leadership Development & Inclusive Living for people with intellectual and developmental disabilities. | Best Buddies is a nonprofit 501(c)(3) organization dedicated to establishing a global volunteer movement that creates opportunities for one-to-one friendships, integrated employment, leadership development, and inclusive living for people with intellectual and developmental disabilities.  

Founded in 1989 by Anthony K. Shriver, Best Buddies is a vibrant, international organization that has grown from one original chapter to almost 1,500 middle school, high school, and college chapters worldwide.

🏆 Best Buddies in Sports: Your Chance to See Gold Medalists, Make Friends, and Support Inclusion! 🏆 Get ready for an action-packed September with Best Buddies! We’re teaming up with top sports clubs to bring you three incredible events that champion inclusion and celebrate the power of friendship. Whether you’re a sports enthusiast or just looking for a fun day out, these events have something for everyone! 🥇 Disability Awareness Day with the Washington Spirit 🗓️ Date: Saturday, September 7 at 12:30 PM 📍 Location: Audi Field, Washington, DC 🎟️ Match: Washington Spirit vs. Portland Thorns FC Get your tickets here: https://lnkd.in/eXGt9WQE ⚽ Best Buddies Night at the Richmond Kickers Soccer Club 🗓️ Date: Saturday, September 21 at 6:00 PM 📍 Location: City Stadium, Richmond, VA 🎟️ Match: Richmond Kickers Soccer Club vs. Lexington Soccer Club Get your tickets here: https://lnkd.in/emp-npTY ⚾ Best Buddies Day at the Ballpark 🗓️ Date: Sunday, September 29 at 3:00 PM 📍 Location: Nationals Park, Washington, DC 🎟️ Match: Washington Nationals vs. Philadelphia Phillies Get your tickets here: https://lnkd.in/ey5fhVrC All venues offer ADA seating to ensure everyone can enjoy the games. Visit our events page to get tickets and explore more exciting Best Buddies activities: https://lnkd.in/edBfDSqE Let’s come together to support inclusion, cheer on our favorite teams, and create unforgettable memories. See you there! 🙌

✨ Volunteer Opportunity: Make a Difference at the Best Buddies Homecoming: Two Parties One Purpose Gala! ✨ Join us on Friday, November 1st, at the TCMA for Ronald Reagan Building and International Trade Center in Washington, DC, for an unforgettable evening dedicated to supporting Best Buddies programs in Virginia & Washington, DC. Sign up to volunteer: https://lnkd.in/eQ5dsp8S 🕑 Shifts: 11 am - 4 pm & 4:45 pm - 11 pm 💼 Roles: - Day of Event Setup: Help with signage, décor, and logistics. - Auction Setup: Assist in setting up the silent auction, a crucial part of our fundraising efforts. - Registration & Checkout: Welcome and check out guests, ensuring they have an enjoyable experience. - Bid Spotters: Support our auctioneer during the live auction by spotting bids. Hear from a past volunteer: "I volunteered at the check-in desk for the 2023 gala, and it was so much fun to welcome everyone in! All the guests were so excited to arrive, and I could tell the event was a huge highlight of the program for them. There was a great environment of positive energy with guests, volunteers, and staff. Even when we had to troubleshoot tech issues, everyone still had a smile on their face. I’m excited to go back in 2024 and help Best Buddies families experience this fun and fancy night out together!" – Elise 🎉 Your enthusiasm and support can make this event a success! Sign up now to be a part of this special night. #BestBuddies #Gala #VolunteerOpportunity #MakeADifference #WashingtonDC

What does it mean to be a nonprofit? For us at Best Buddies in Virginia & DC, it means committing to a mission that is bigger than ourselves—creating a world where individuals with intellectual and developmental disabilities (IDD) are included, valued, and empowered. 💜 To celebrate #NationalNonprofitDay tomorrow, we're reflecting on our role in the community, which is to: 👯♂️ Foster friendships between people with and without IDD 👨💻 Provide meaningful employment opportunities to individuals with IDD 📣 Promote leadership development in the IDD community As a nonprofit, we rely on the generosity of volunteers, donors, and advocates to carry out our mission. Thank you to everyone who has donated their time, resources, and voice. You have made a significant impact. Join us today in building a more inclusive world: 👉 https://lnkd.in/ePGFMsz #NationalNonprofitDay #BestBuddies #InclusionMatters #BestBuddiesVADC

Welcome Our New Advisory Board Members! We are thrilled to announce the addition of four incredible individuals to the Best Buddies in Virginia & DC Advisory Board! 🎉 Each brings a wealth of experience and a unique perspective that will undoubtedly enrich our community and further our mission of creating opportunities for friendship, employment, leadership development, and inclusive living for people with intellectual and developmental disabilities. Meet our newest members: Brita H., Student, University of Virginia 🧡 “I’m incredibly excited to join the advisory board as a student member. Growing up with my amazing sister Audrey—who has Down syndrome—has shown me how much inclusion and friendship can make a difference. I loved being a part of and leading my school chapter at Wakefield High School and the University of Virginia. I’m thrilled to take my commitment to Best Buddies further by joining the board. Some of my favorite Best Buddies memories include singing karaoke at chapter meetings, going to the friendship walk and homecoming dance, attending the International BB Leadership Conference, and hosting an IDD information night at my school. I can’t wait to make more memories and work with the board to promote inclusion! ” Allyson Waldrep, Director, Tiffany & Co. 💙 "From personal bonds to corporate partnerships, I've experienced the profound impact of Best Buddies in weaving a tapestry of inclusion. I'm thrilled to join their Board of Directors and further champion our shared vision for community unity and empowerment." Elisabeth Rice, Associate Professor, Special Education and Disability Studies, The George Washington University 💛 "I am very excited to have the opportunity to serve on the Advisory Board of Best Buddies VA/DC. To me, building kind, joyous relationships is the key to happiness. This organization is all about strong relationships and interconnectedness. I can't wait to be more involved." Zachary Slade, Consultant, Accenture We are excited to have Brita, Allyson, Elisabeth, and Zachary join us and bring their passion and expertise to our board. Together, we will continue to work towards building a more inclusive and supportive community for everyone. Please join us in giving a warm welcome to our new board members! 🎊 #BestBuddies #Inclusion #Community #Welcome

SAVE THE DATE: Best Buddies Homecoming: Two Parties One Purpose Gala 🗓 Friday, November 1 Last year's Homecoming left a lasting impact: “It was amazing to see so many other people who share the same passion for Best Buddies,” said Drew. What to Expect ✨ Indulge in culinary delights crafted by local chefs and their Best Buddy Sous Chefs 🍸 Enjoy delicious drinks and cocktails 🏆 Honor the Champion of the Year candidates—advocates who have tirelessly supported our mission 🎁 Participate in silent and live auctions featuring amazing items from our community and beyond Join us for a night filled with joy, excitement, and the spirit of friendship! Check out a recap of last year's event: https://lnkd.in/eUzJH2it Why Attend? We aim to raise $260,000 to support local Best Buddies programs in Virginia & DC. Happy #TransitionsTuesday! Last week, 9 students joined Best Buddies in Virginia & DC Manager of Transitions Erin Ijzer for a Transitions Workshop. Students learned skills in positive self-talk, self-advocacy, how to present an elevator pitch, and what you want to include in a resume. Topics covered vocational interests, SMART goals, and independent living. "A fun fact about me is that I have a twin". These students had a great time engaging with the content covered in the Transitions workshop with Best Buddies! "I loved learning how to give an elevator pitch and having the opportunity to present my pitch to my peers" said one twin. "I really enjoyed learning about what my options are after high school - I didn't know there were so many!" said the other twin. The Best Buddies Transitions Program aims to support students as they explore their next steps after high school. Are you interested in attending other Transitions workshops? Contact Manager of Transitions, Erin Ijzer at erinijzer@bestbuddies.org.

💚 A huge thank you to Paycom for volunteering with us last Friday! 💚 Their #volunteer work was truly exceptional. They brought incredible energy and dedication, packing chapter welcome bags, rolling t-shirts, writing motivational notes, and more. Their teamwork and organization were wonderful, and the assembly line at the end was spectacular! Our wonderful State Ambassador, Kaitlin Andersen, joined the group to share her experience with Best Buddies in high school and, most recently, at the Best Buddies Leadership Conference. She encouraged everyone to check out their local Best Buddies chapter and join a Friendship Walk in the spring! The efforts of the dedicated volunteers will make a significant impact on our chapter presidents as they start the new school year, encouraging them to create wonderful one-to-one friendships at their schools. Best Buddies is dedicated to ending the social, physical, and economic isolation of the 200 million people with intellectual and developmental disabilities. On Friday, Paycom brought our mission to life. Thank you! Are you interested in volunteering with us? Fill out our volunteer form: https://lnkd.in/e-MpYWid #intern ##NationalInternDay #GiveBack #IDD #BestBuddies

"Be all you can be." 🌎 What a weekend for inclusion! Over 2,000 Best Buddies leaders, volunteers, and community advocates from around the globe united at Indiana University Bloomington for a transformative 3-day leadership conference. ✨ High school students, jobs participants, ambassadors, and inclusive living residents from Best Buddies in Virginia & DC came together to imagine, create, lead, and empower the future of the disability rights and inclusion movement. 💃 This dedicated and compassionate group of young individuals is ready to change the world. Highlights included dancing at the opening and closing ceremonies, competing in the Inclusion Olympics, and celebrating at Festival of Friendship. We were motivated by keynote speakers Annette Addo-Yobo, M.A., Mia Armstrong, Mickey Rowe, Kelsey O'Connor, and Kennedy Garcia. Performances by Michale Housefield, Marlana VanHoose, Larger Than Life, Jensen Gering, the Indianapolis Colts Cheerleaders, and Cory Singer added to the excitement. 💛 Over the past 30 years, the Best Buddies Leadership Conference (BBLC) has inspired thousands of leaders to advocate for inclusion and bring about social change in their communities. As Best Buddies in Virginia & DC jobs participant Alex P. says, “Be all you can be.” 💖 Ella N. from Bishop O'Connell High School shared, “My favorite part of LC was being surrounded by individuals of all abilities and getting to come together to support the same cause.” 💙 Adam B. from Meridian High School also shared, “My favorite part of LC was meeting everybody and making new friends. The thing I’m excited to bring back is all the fun activity ideas I got from other members of our delegation. The biggest thing I learned was how to be more inclusive, how to make things more accessible, and to think more in that mindset.” 🙌 Thank you to everyone who attended and made this event possible. Let's continue to advocate and lead for a more inclusive world! #Leadership #SelfAdvocacy #Inclusion #Friendship #InclusiveLiving #IntegratedEmployment

🗣 "I want to change how people see adults and children with disabilities because we can do things that other people can do. I want people to see what we’re capable of even though we have disabilities and how we do things differently than other people as well." 👑 Meet the newest Best Buddies in Virginia & DC Ambassador, Naia Grace. She got started with Best Buddies at the University of Virginia, located in her hometown of Charlottesville, VA. She graduated from Charlottesville High School in 2017 with a standard diploma and was crowned homecoming queen! 🏊♀️ Her favorite hobbies include taking hikes with friends and family, food photography, swimming, reading, and playing with Groovy Girls. Naia’s current favorite television shows include The Hunger Games, Master Chef, and WWE. 🎓 Naia recently moved from Charlottesville to the DC/NOVA area. She is looking forward to taking on this new leadership role and getting further involved with Best Buddies programs. 📣 “By getting more people involved in Best Buddies, I would like to change Best Buddies for the better," she said. "I want to change how people see adults and children with disabilities because we can do things that other people can do. I want people to see what we’re capable of even though we have disabilities and how we do things differently than other people as well.” 💚 Naia attended her first Ambassador training at Deloitte’s annual Impact Day. 🙌 Best Buddies Ambassadors gives people with and without IDD the opportunity to gain the public speaking skills, self-esteem, and confidence needed to successfully advocate for themselves, their peers, and Best Buddies in communities, workplaces, and government. The program aims to educate and empower generations of leaders, public speakers, and advocates for inclusion. ➡ Read more about Naia and the Best Buddies Ambassadors program here: https://lnkd.in/dbw5Hhcd #DisabilityAdvocacy #IDD #Leadership #DeloitteImpactDay

🇺🇸 July 26th is the 34th anniversary of the signing of the Americans with Disabilities Act (#ADA), which affirms and protects the rights of people with disabilities to participate in public life and ensures that all people with disabilities have the same rights and opportunities as everyone else. 🌟 Best Buddies in Virginia & DC is proud to support the #ADA and celebrate inclusion every day! 🔎 We've gathered a small list of resources to help you learn more about the impact and significance of this landmark legislation. 💜 How the ADA Changed the Build World: https://lnkd.in/dZXna5Wf 💛 The ADA Explained: https://lnkd.in/db6yaJSd 🧡 Judy Heumann: The Mother of ADA: https://lnkd.in/dTnu8S5f ❤️ A Disability History of the United States by Kim Nielsen: https://lnkd.in/dn6cWPNu 💙 Demystifying Disability by Emily Ladau: https://lnkd.in/gCGBhpC9 📜 Americans With Disabilities Act: https://www.ada.gov/ ❓Why do you support the ADA? What else can be done to improve accessibility? Share your thoughts in the comments! #ThanksToTheADA #ADA34 #DisabilityPride #ADAAnniversary
